profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-11-12 14:43:12 -0500.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into eight series: Subject files; Notebooks; Correspondence; Meetings, ceremonies, lectures, and professional travel; Curricular material; Publications and presentations; Papers by other scientists; Photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes papers documenting Allan M. Cormack's professional life, beginning with his early career at the University of Cape Town. The bulk of the material originates from Cormack's years as a professor of physics at Tufts. The material includes correspondence; notes and calculations; experimental data; reports, manuscripts, preprints, and reprints; lectures; course material; overhead transparencies; photographs; and video footage of a television interview with Cormack. These items relate to Cormack's scientific interests, including his research in particle and medical physics and applied mathematics, as well as other aspects of his physics career, such as pedagogical and administrative duties and peer and tenure review. Also recorded are Cormack's activities relating to the Nobel Prize and the Nobel Foundation.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Allan MacLeod Cormack (1924-1998) joined Tufts in 1957 as a professor in the Department of Physics. A faculty member for 22 years, he received the Ballou Medal in 1978, and won the 1979 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for his work developing the computerized axial tomography (CAT) scan.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Any intellectual property rights that the donor possesses have been transferred to Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subject files kept by Allan MacLeod Cormack. The material documents Cormack's research in particle and medical physics and mathematics, in addition to other aspects of his professional life, including peer review for journals, colleagues' tenure review, and activities concerning the Nobel Prize and the Nobel Foundation. Most of the files are organized by scientific topics, with additional files categorized by names of individuals, organizations, and institutions and by titles of publications. The material includes research notes; experimental data; drafts, preprints, and reprints of papers; correspondence; overhead transparencies; and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains Cormack's notebooks. Looseleaf notes removed from binders, as well as a few bound notebooks. Cormack labeled most of the binders and notebooks by subject. The material originates from Cormack's time at the University of Cape Town through his years on the Tufts faculty. It includes research notes and calculations, drafts of papers for publication, experimental data, reprints, correspondence, and X-ray images of archaeological and fine arts objects.
Included in this material are notes, data, and drafts used to prepare the 1963 and 1964 radiological papers for which Cormack was awarded the Nobel Prize.

did.unittitle: Untitled notebook, research notes and data, University of Cape Town
Untitled notebook, tutorials, absorption data, University of Cape Town
Untitled notebook, mathematical notes, particle physics
Untitled notebook, radon transform, test of July 1963 data

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes correspondence received and sent by Cormack, organized by last name of correspondent (including individuals, organizations, and institutions). Most of the correspondence was exchanged with colleagues about research matters, although non-professional correspondence is included as well. The files also contain a number of reprints.

did.unittitle: Meetings, ceremonies, lectures, and professional travel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains material relating to conferences, invited lectures, award ceremonies, interviews, and other professional events and travel. Cormack arranged the files chronologically by event or destination. The material includes correspondence, notes for lectures delivered, conference programs and proceedings, papers discussed, and overhead transparencies for presentations. Documentation of travel expenses has been discarded. Among the events documented are meetings and ceremonies for Nobel Prize winners.

did.unittitle: Museum of Science and Industry, Chicago
American Medical International, Long Island, June 12-19
Health and Human Services, Washington, November 4-6
George Washington University Medical Center, October 30-November 2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains material from binders and files containing lecture notes, homework assignments, exams, and syllabi for undergraduate physics courses taught by Cormack.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by course number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains reprints of Cormack's publications; notes and overhead transparencies for scientific presentations; and video tapes of a 1997 interview of Cormack for Naked to the Bone, a television documentary about the history of medical imaging technology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Physics and mathematics manuscripts, reprints, reports, and book chapters. Includes some patents by Godfrey Hounsfield, Cormack's fellow Nobelist for Physiology or Medicine in 1979. Papers published in journals readily available elsewhere that were not annotated by Cormack or the author have been discarded, but are listed by author:
Entire Issues:
The Journal of General Microbiology 4/1 (January 1950).
Occasional Notes of the Royal Astronomical Society, Number 9 (June 1941).

Proceedings of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers 66/5 (May 1978). [Cover labeled "Horn," probably referring to article in this issue by B. K. P. Horn, "Density Reconstruction Using Arbitrary Ray-Sampling Schemes."]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs, provided primarily by the Office of Communications and Public Relations, depicting Allan Cormack.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two Photographs of Allan Cormack One copyrighted by Walter S. Silver, other by Seth Resnick c 1989
